data.title: Auburn Hills, 48326 Crime Rates and Crime Statistics
data.meta_description: Most accurate 2021 crime rates for Auburn Hills, MI. Your chance of being a victim of violent crime in Auburn Hills is 1 in 268 and property crime is 1 in 51. Compare Auburn Hills crime data to other cities, states, and neighborhoods in the U.S. on NeighborhoodScout.
data.text:
The crime rate in Auburn Hills is considerably higher than the national average across all communities in America from the largest to the smallest, although at 24 crimes per one thousand residents, it is not among the communities with the very highest crime rate. The chance of becoming a victim of either violent or property crime in Auburn Hills is 1 in 43. Based on FBI crime data, Auburn Hills is not one of the safest communities in America. Relative to Michigan, Auburn Hills has a crime rate that is higher than 88% of the state's cities and towns of all sizes.

Importantly, when you compare Auburn Hills to other communities of similar population, then Auburn Hills crime rate (violent and property crimes combined) is quite a bit higher than average. Regardless of how Auburn Hills does relative to all communities in America of all sizes, when NeighborhoodScout compared it to communities of similar population size, its crime rate per thousand residents stands out as higher than most.

Now let us turn to take a look at how Auburn Hills does for violent crimes specifically, and then how it does for property crimes. This is important because the overall crime rate can be further illuminated by understanding if violent crime or property crimes (or both) are the major contributors to the general rate of crime in Auburn Hills.

From our analysis, we discovered that violent crime in Auburn Hills occurs at a rate higher than in most communities of all population sizes in America. The chance that a person will become a victim of a violent crime in Auburn Hills; such as armed robbery, aggravated assault, rape or murder; is 1 in 268. This equates to a rate of 4 per one thousand inhabitants.

NeighborhoodScout's analysis also reveals that Auburn Hills's rate for property crime is 20 per one thousand population. This makes Auburn Hills a place where there is an above average chance of becoming a victim of a property crime, when compared to all other communities in America of all population sizes. Property crimes are motor vehicle theft, arson, larceny, and burglary. Your chance of becoming a victim of any of these crimes in Auburn Hills is one in 51.
